H0.text: Dissociation is the separation of ions that occurs when a solid ionic compound dissolves.

H1.text: Combustion is the separation of ions that occurs when a solid ionic compound dissolves.

H2.text: Decomposition is the separation of ions that occurs when a solid ionic compound dissolves.

H3.text: Inflammation is the separation of ions that occurs when a solid ionic compound dissolves.

A4.text: The dissociation of salts by solvation in a solution, such as water, means the separation of the anions and cations.
